The PPAs at Rattlesnake Creek represent the technology industry’s first aggregated purchase of wind energy. Until 2029, the companies will share the output of the wind project, with Adobe purchasing the energy produced by 10 MW of Rattlesnake Creek and Facebook purchasing the energy produced by the remaining 310 MW of the project.

Adobe believes that when it comes to the environment, collaboration is the only way forward. And at Enel Green Power, we couldn’t agree more. {{item.label}}

                Sustainability Highlights
            
An Award-Winning Partnership
For the past three years, Smart Energy Decisions has held an Innovation Awards competition, recognizing exemplary use of innovative technologies and progressive practices among large electric power users and their suppliers. In the 2020 program, Adobe received a Customer Project Award in the Commercial Offsite Renewable Energy category, recognizing the partnership with Enel Green Power at the Rattlesnake Creek wind farm. Find out more
